result.execSummary:
The defendant Malcolm T Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 09-01-17 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. Cash bail applied.
The first 10 days are STRAIGHT TIME, the balance can be served with release privileges for the Day Report Program. No objection to the electronic monitoring while in the program
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malcolm T Rogers

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) gj
No reply from defendant or surety.  sb
There was no signature bond ordered in this case.  sb

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel, Charlene R. and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction - the first 10 days are straight time - the balance can be served with release privileges for the Day Report Program - no objection to the electronic monitoring while in the program and 44 days credit; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 9-1-17 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Malcolm T Rogers in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Malcolm T Rogers in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.
Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.

Defendant Malcolm T Rogers in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Malcolm T Rogers in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Malcolm T Rogers not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 33 for BRANCH 44
Defendant not produced, appearance waived.  Defendant picked up new cases.    Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $2,500 cash.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Br. 44 is not in session for two weeks.  Attorney Epps will not be available starting 8-28-15 to 9-10-15. Case is set for return on warrant with the pair judge, Judge Ashley, Br. 33.  Case is set on 8-27-15 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 33./ds

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court notes that a warrant was issued on 06-18-2015 in Branch 3.  Defendant failing to appear for today's scheduled preliminary hearing, Court takes no further action as warrant is still active.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint DIscharge Summary dated June 24, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

15RM029912  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-17-2015

Branch 17 addressed this violation as Branch 3 was not available.  

 JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Case heard by Branch 17 for Branch 3 as they are unvailable.
Attorney Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Justice Point report states that the defendant had a positive drug test, and then absconded fron Justice Point. Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Court will leave on the preliminary hearing scheduled for 06/25/2015.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for ENHANCED Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Malcolm T Rogers not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Court sets bail.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing on 6/25/2015 at 8:30 am, branch PE.  aw
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Clerk contacted the public defender's office to have defendant I formed, and a public attorney appointed.  Case adjourned for return on warrant on 6/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
No reply from surety/defendant.
Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Justice Point discharge summary report, received and filed.  aw
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court.  Antonella Aleman for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is called on the record at 3:33 pm.
The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/26/15.

15RM014825  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/18/15

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Malcolm T Rogers in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Malcolm T Rogers in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
